dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S469 IS: Family Farm and Small Business Exemption Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Ernst (for herself, Mr. Bennet, Mr. Grassley, Mr. Marshall, Mr. Justice, Mr. Moran, Mr. Hoeven, Mr. Rounds, Mr. Boozman, and Mr. Tillis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To restore the exemption of family farms and small businesses from the definition of assets under title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Family Farm and Small Business Exemption Act.

section.header: Exempting family farms and small businesses from assets under the Higher Education Act of 1965

subsection.text: Section 480(f)(2) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087vv(f)(2)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking net value of the and inserting the following:
by striking the period at the end and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: a family farm on which the family resides; or
a small business with not more than 100 full-time or full-time equivalent employees (or any part of such a small business) that is owned and controlled by the family.

subsection.text: The amendments made by subsection (a) shall apply to need analysis conducted under part F of title IV of the Higher Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 1087kk et seq.) for award years beginning on or after the date of the enactment of this Act.
